newsitem.title: SPAIN: Telefonica opens lower, recoups in heavy trade.
newsitem.headline: Telefonica opens lower, recoups in heavy trade.

text.p: Telefonica shares opened lower, then recouped in heavy volume on Friday after news that it has reached a global alliance with British Telecommunications and U.S. group MCI Communications Corp, dealers said.
At 0805 GMT, the shares were up 10 pesetas to 3,575 on volume of over one million shares. It opened down 10 pesetas to 3,555 after a 50 peseta rise on Thursday.
The Ibex-35 index of leading shares was down 0.3 percent to 5,612.72.
"I'd take advantage of any weakness to buy. The news is partly discounted but not totally," said a dealer at a foreign brokerage.
But other dealers were more sceptical of what progress the shares could make over the day.
"The market hasn't had any time to evaluate the news and from Telefonica's point of view there have been few details," said one dealer at a Spanish bank.
Telefonica is to give a news conference at 1100 GMT today.
BT said today that Telefonica would take a one percent stake in BT and the UK operator would in turn buy a two percent stake in Telefonica.
Telefonica Internacional (TISA) and MCI are also to create a pan-American joint venture, managed by TISA, to pursue Latin American opportunities.
